trans-unit.source: Defines a decoder that requires delayed bitmap creation such as asynchronous image downloads.
A LateBoundBitmapDecoder is used when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions> is specified.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder.Decoder%2A> property creates the necessary "real decoder" on an on-demand basis.
All decoder properties return `null` while content is downloading.
A LateBoundBitmapDecoder can also be created when the system has an image that is being asynchronously downloaded locally.
In this case, the decoder also returns `null` for properties until the image has been downloaded.

The application can check the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder.IsDownloading%2A> property or add a delegate for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder.DownloadCompleted> event to monitor the download status.
Furthermore, any frames obtained from a LateBoundBitmapDecoder while the image is downloading will return a width/height of 1,1 until the frames have finished downloading.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> objects that are returned by this class are frozen and are therefore immutable.
Gets information that describes this codec.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
If the late bound decoder is still downloading, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that represents the color profile that is associated with a bitmap, if one is defined.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> that represents the embedded color profile of the bitmap.

If no color profile has been defined, or if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder"></xref> is still downloading content, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets the underlying decoder that is associated with this late-bound decoder.
The underlying <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref>.
If the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder"></xref> is still downloading a bitmap, the underlying decoder is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Otherwise, the underlying decoder is created on first access.
Gets the content of an individual frame within a bitmap.

Because a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder> is downloaded asynchronously, it is possible for the underlying collection of Frames to change after content is downloaded and decoded.
While content is downloading, the collection always returns at least one item.
When downloading and decoding are complete, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> automatically changes its underlying content.
In other words, only the collection object can change; the actual frame object remains the same.
Any frame obtained from a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder> while the image is downloading will return a width/height of `1,1` until the frames have finished downloading.
Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] images support more than one frame.
Any <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> objects that this property returns are frozen.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a value that indicates whether the decoder is currently downloading content.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the decoder is downloading content; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref> that is associated with this decoder.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref> that is associated with this decoder.

If the bitmap has no palette, or if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder"></xref> is still downloading content, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the global preview of this bitmap, if one is defined.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> that this property returns is frozen.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the global preview of the bitmap.

If no preview is defined, or if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder"></xref> is still downloading content, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the thumbnail of the bitmap, if one is defined.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> that this property returns is frozen.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents a thumbnail of the bitmap.

If no thumbnail is defined, or if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.LateBoundBitmapDecoder"></xref> is still downloading content, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
